e1.description: X->Known or Known->X, for subject unknown or object unknown respectively.

e2.description: A biolink predicate such as biolink:treats, from the biolink list.

e3.description: A CURIE such as MONDO:0011719; you can ask a Monarch action to get a CURIE from a name.

pubmed_id.description: The PubMed (or PubMed Central ID) for the article.

content.text:
# Knowledge Graph: entities related to MONDO:0011719 via treats

The graph includes the following relationships:

### TREATS OR APPLIED OR STUDIED TO TREAT GASTROINTESTINAL STROMAL
- larotrectinib treats or applied or studied to treat gastrointestinal stromal tumor
- Amphomycin treats or applied or studied to treat gastrointestinal stromal tumor
- osimertinib treats or applied or studied to treat gastrointestinal stromal tumor
- cilostazol treats or applied or studied to treat gastrointestinal stromal tumor
- cinacalcet treats or applied or studied to treat gastrointestinal stromal tumor
- cycloheximide treats or applied or studied to treat gastrointestinal stromal tumor
- glucose treats or applied or studied to treat gastrointestinal stromal tumor
- pexidartinib treats or applied or studied to treat gastrointestinal stromal tumor
- temsirolimus treats or applied or studied to treat gastrointestinal stromal tumor
- sirolimus treats or applied or studied to treat gastrointestinal stromal tumor
- temozolomide treats or applied or studied to treat gastrointestinal stromal tumor

### TREATS SMALL INTESTINAL GASTROINTESTINAL STROMAL
- imatinib treats Small Intestinal Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor

### TREATS GASTRIC GASTROINTESTINAL STROMAL
- Splenectomy treats Gastric Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor

### TARGET TREATS EXTRAGASTROINTESTINAL GASTROINTESTINAL STROMAL
- Molecular Target treats Extragastrointestinal Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor

### CHEMOTHERAPY TREATS GASTROINTESTINAL STROMAL
- Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy treats Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors

### TREATS GASTROINTESTINAL STROMAL
- ipilimumab treats Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors
- bortezomib treats Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors
- fletchers' treats Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors
- Clip treats Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors
- phenothiazine treats Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors
- Hysterectomy treats Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors

### 2 INHIBITORS TREATS GASTROINTESTINAL STROMAL
- Cyclooxygenase 2 Inhibitors treats Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors

### TOTAL RIGHT LOBECTOMY TREATS GASTROINTESTINAL STROMAL
- Hepatectomy, total right lobectomy treats Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors

### ON ANUS TREATS GASTROINTESTINAL STROMAL
- Operations on anus treats Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors

### PROTOCOL TREATS GASTROINTESTINAL STROMAL
- bleomycin/methotrexate/vincristine protocol treats Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors

Identify any patterns or insights based solely on what the graph shows, and then offer your own insights such as other concepts that may be interesting to pursue based on the data and why.

content.text:
Title: Metal substitutions incarbonic anhydrase: a halide ion probe study.

Abstract: According to the risk classification of recurrence, the standard treatment for gastrointestinal stromal tumor(GIST)is complete surgical resection and postoperative adjuvant therapy with imatinib; however, the usefulness of neoadjuvant therapy is unclear. We report a case of giant GIST in the pelvis suspectedly having bladder infiltration that was radically resected and underwent preoperative imatinib therapy. A 52-year-old man visited a clinic because of abdominal pain, fever, and frequent urination. An abdominal mass was determined, and the patient was referred to our hospital for detailed examination and treatment. Contrast-enhanced CT revealed a 17 cm diameter irregular mass from the lower navel to the pelvis, and the bladder boundary was partially unclear. Transrectal biopsy was performed using endoscopic ultrasonography, and according to the Fletcher classification, a high-risk GIST was diagnosed. After preoperative imatinib therapy of 400 mg/day was administered for 3 months, surgery was performed. The tumor was strongly adhered to the bladder, but no invasion was observed, and partial small intestine resection was performed. The surgical margin was negative without capsule damage. On day 34 postoperatively, imatinib therapy was resumed, and as of 1 year postoperatively, the course is well without recurrence.
